channel.title: Autosave When You Close Server Source?
channel.description:
Yeah guys..So I've been updating my server a lot lately and its just a lot faster to close server source directly(black box) than to use ::update command. But problem is when I close source directly everyone is rolledback to their last log in. Is there a way to fix it so I don't have to use ::update? =S
Rep++ for anyone that can help.
PS: My autosave every (1min/?) in config does not work. I am using a PI base.

item.title: Autosave When You Close Server Source?
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Go into your commands class and add this command

	[code=java]if(playerCommand.equals("saveall")) 
	{
	      for (final Player p : PlayerHandler.players) 
	{
		if (p != null) 
		{
			PlayerSave.saveGame((Client) p);
		}
	}
	System.out.println("Saved all games.");
}[/code]

NOTE: You are going to get 1 cannon’t find symbol error maybe 2, you need to figure out what to import to the class.
and use this command right before you close the cmd window.

Read full topic
item.source: Autosave When You Close Server Source?

item.title: Autosave When You Close Server Source?
item.dc:creator: @tchandle tchandle
item.description:
@tchandle wrote:

Anc13ntsIsBack:

So you’re saying you can’t type - ::update 1 - wait 1 second, let it save then close it? If you exit out by clicking the [ x ] button before it saves, then no it won’t save. That’s common sense.

Now you’re making me sound lazy…=\

Read full topic
